ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend students to take the course, as it was a very helpful and thought provoking look at research ethics. I also valued having EEB and FES students taking the course together.

This course is about what practical problems we may face as a graduate student and later in research area. It's very useful, especially for a beginner in science. I will recommend this course to another student because although what can be learned in this course may not be directly related to the research, it may influence the career much.
it was a required course for me but i ended up really looking forward to it. all phd students should take it.
This class is a discussion-based summary of important ethical issues in science. It is a required course.

The course did a nice job covering research ethics that are integral to our work. I would certainly recommend it to another student, because everything discussed is quite helpful to our future scientific careers.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The course helped me gain some perspective on how the scientific process works and especially how to avoid unethical actions. The course also helped me with my own research, as I learned how to avoid placing myself in situations where conflicts of interest or personal conflict might compromise the quality of my research.
This course is not directly related to what we do for research. However, the problems this course deal with may be even more important than research in future career.
I learned a lot about what to expect and how to behave in the academic world. I feel like this course actually did a lot to prepare me to be a scientist.
helped me understand what it is to be an academic as a career.
This course helped me think more about the ethics of my research and my own ethical responsibilities.
This course was well-taught and is very helpful in aiding my future research.
